page.title: 04JERSEY LANE:ST.ALBANS
page.content: {Jersey Lane}is a very old bridleway. It once went past Evans Farm and then on to House Lane near Sandridge.In the 19th century Evans Farm changed its name to Jersey Farm. Over the years houses have been built next to Jersey Lane and so now it runs through a built up area. From Marshalswick Lane it runs east, crossing Barnfield Rd. and Ardens Way.About 70 metres east of Ardens Way it turns north and continues until it joins House Lane.{ The woody plants in the hedgerows are hawthorn, beech, oak, elder,holly,ash, sycamore and horsechestnut. We found 6 of these in a 30 metre stretch. This means that the hedge is approx.500yrs. old. In front of the hedge we found violets, ivy, cow parsley, nettles, fern bracken,forget-me-nots,foxgloves, dock,cow parsley and lesser celendine.
